basics.name: Christopher Willis
basics.label: Web Developer, SEO/SEM Assistant
basics.summary: Life long geek and lover of technology. When I am not playing board games I am online pursuing my many interests. Got into coding at a more fundemental level with C++, but am loving higher level laungauges like Javascript and Python. Broad experience base with web (full stack), mostly in the MERN stack.

work.summary: Part of a team targeting our google long tail campaign
highlights: Execute various social media campaigns on YouTube, Google, Foursquare, as well as link disavowment tactics and other white hat strategies for organic development and traffic defense
Focus on content creation for SEO campaigns, creating over ten thousand videos, thousands of KML for Google Maps, and thousands of reference markers on Foursquare
Maintain an organic traffic growth that exceeded our yearly targets through constant diligence and trial and error
Collaborate to aggressively target keywords and work with engineers to optimize long tail searches
Assist in quality assurance testing (noted for ability to find odd bugs that escape most testing)
Support customer and B2B client questions

work.summary: Fixed all normal IT problems including phone systems, ran reports for all managers for call data
highlights: Rewired a new office space to accommodate over 70 work stations for phone and internet
Assisted in the transition from analog to VOIP phone environment
Fulfilled all technical reports for the Sales and Operations Teams using Crystal Reports and FoxPro
Was in charge of regular and emergency maintenance of all equipment and technical issues
Facilitated all functions of a Network Administrator, System Administrator, Database Administrator, and Technical Support

work.summary: Created training manual for taining C programmers to use Clarion, rewrite legacy code
highlights: Learned Database Key Management Software IDE (Clarion)
Developed crossover training manual for C/C++ programmers to Clarion environment
Designed and implemented tools and objects in sister (template) language for Clarion
Troubleshot bugs in both hardware and software
Rewrote legacy code that didnâ€™t meet naming and other coding standards
